main event: On September 7, 1956, an observer spotted a round white object, the size of a softball at arm's length, hovering and rising before moving 52 to 54 feet at a high rate of speed. The duration of the observation was 10 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as a round white object, similar in size to a softball at arm's length.
It hovered, rose, and then moved at a high rate of speed, covering a distance of 52 to 54 feet.
The strong probability of a balloon was indicated due to wind and hovering, leading to the evaluation of the object as possibly a balloon.
The observer was searching the area for aircraft when the object was spotted at an altitude of 12,000 feet, moving rapidly to the southeast.
The observation lasted for a total of 10 minutes, providing a detailed account of the object's behavior.
sighted object: Round white object the size of a softball at arm's length
